choices: Adler’s psychology was at odds with Freudian psychology and laid down foundations for an entirely new approach that centred on the individual and his capacity for goodness.
Contrary to Freudian psychology, Adler’s psychology sought peace and goodness among human beings and integrated it with the peace and goodness among his fellow beings.
Whereas Freud believed that man was self-centred and always faced internal conflict, Adler thought that man was at peace with himself and others, and also pursued a purpose.
Adler was a pioneer in harmonic psychology and believed in the goodness of man. He also treated human mind as an integrated whole.

text: Key words: Freud believed, man, selfish, Adler said, seeks harmony, mind consisted of, three components, constantly in conflict, integrated whole, Alder believes in goodness of man.
